title: Research Assistant (76787-095)
text:
Fixed term contract for 12 months. 
Are you a junior researcher looking to grow your experience in the field of neuroimaging? 
If so, a great opportunity has arisen to join Dr Thomas Nichols’ Wellcome Trust Senior Research Fellowship in Basic Biomedical Science, on a project entitled “Transforming Statistical Methodology for Neuroimaging Meta-Analysis”. 
The use of meta-analysis in functional brain imaging is rapidly growing as the discipline has matured and a large and diverse literature has become available. The informatics challenges in this area are immense, as standard current practice is to manually transcribe or, at best, copy-and-paste analysis results into a manuscript. Despite recent advances in automating neuroimaging meta-analysis, the enterprise is hobbled by a lack of standards and methods to keep track of results provenance. 
Using your knowledge of matlab, R, and unix, you will support the research activity across the board, gaining a valuable insight into the workings and outputs expected from a major funded research project. We are particularly keen to hear from applicants with some experience with neuroimaging data and the Neuroimaging Data Model (NIDM). 
You will have an Honours degree in a relevant subject such as Mathematic or Statistics and demonstrate a flexible approach to supporting research requirements. Share this job
